alert.note: Alert for Sioux (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 1:58PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST/11 PM MST/ TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM CST /2 PM MST/ WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory today, snow and blowing snow with winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory Wednesday and Thursday, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Sioux County. * WHEN...For the current Winter Weather Advisory, until Midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to Noon CST Thursday. For the next Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM Wednesday to Noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel due to snow and blowing snow reducing visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing.
